snippet: New York City’s Department of Records and Information Services released Friday thousands of newly digitized images, including ones collected in the ’30s and ’40s by the Bureau of Criminal Alien Investigation.
abstract: New York City’s Department of Records and Information Services releases 30,000 newly digitized images, including photos collected in the ’30s and ’40s by the Bureau of Criminal Alien Investigation; bureau, offshoot of New York Police Department, was tasked with monitoring potentially dangerous immigrant and political groups.
lead_paragraph: New York City’s Department of Records and Information Services released Friday thousands of newly digitized images, including ones collected in the ’30s and ’40s by the Bureau of Criminal Alien Investigation.
